page.title: 01TYPE OF AREA
page.content: This is a remote and very hilly region ideal for walking, rough shooting etc. The bare grassy hills are deeply intersected by narrow valleys, usually with a fast-flowing stream down to the River Teme.The valleys are well wooded mostly with deciduous trees and the bird life is prolific, with game birds reared for sport.Badgers make their home in the area, and there are considerable numbers of foxes. The land is nearly all intensively managed grassland, and is used for pasture,hay,grass and silage.The highest hill rises to 1248ft. The farms and homesteads are remote and widely scattered.They are all family units. The River Teme in its upper reaches runs through the valley and for the most part forms the boundary between England and Wales.
